alert.note: Alert for Dickinson; Menominee (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Dickinson and northwestern Menominee Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 215 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Norway, or 10 miles southeast of Iron Mountain, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Dickinson and northwestern Menominee Counties, including the following locations... Loretto, Waucedah, Faithorn, Cunard and Vulcan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
